author: nero_eth
content:
The proposer will pull the payload, right? 
So, if not signed for a specific builder, malicious builders could make other builder work for nothing by sending them a fake registration that is not supposed to arrive with them without the proposer being aware that it could pull from that tricked builder.
Are registrations propagated or just a direct connection between proposer and builder?

author: nero_eth
content:
Since registrations are direct connections, I don't see any issue with including more fields - providing more flexibility. 

Today, builders check at which relay the proposer is registered. Since registrations can be replayed to any relay by anyone (which has happened) builders cannot really trust that the proposer is actually registered at that relay or if the registration at another relay was replayed. Builders would then, in doupt, submit to the relay.
